title: Go Tell It On the Mountain epiphany

content.question: The epiphany that John has toward the end of the final paragraph (“. . . for was it not he, in his false pride and his evil imagination, who was filthy?”) is a moment in which

choices.label: he decides that he must do something to improve his circumstances
his judgment of himself as well as of others leads him to feel intense guilt
his love for his family overwhelms his irritation with their behavior
his thoughts about himself turn to thoughts about helping others

content.answer: his judgment of himself as well as of others leads him to feel intense guilt

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain the function of a character changing or remaining unchanged.
